results.headline: Before the Sword Fights, Cue the Harem Girls

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time

results.summary_short: In “Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time” Jake Gyllenhaal leads a Bruckheimer-style invasion in ancient Iran.

results.headline: The Founders of Cubism, Ardent Fans of Film
results.display_title: Picasso & Braque Go to the Movies

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Picasso & Braque Go to the Movies

results.summary_short: “Picasso and Braque Go to the Movies” argues that film was a crucial formative influence on Modern painting, especially Cubism.

results.headline: Misfits Battle the Masters of War

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Micmacs

results.summary_short: In Jean-Pierre Jeunet’s “Micmacs,” a band of misfits takes a fight to two arms companies.

results.headline: Operation Desert Togs

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Sex and the City 2

results.summary_short: “Sex and the City 2” banishes the possibility of sadness as it takes Carrie and her friends to the Middle East.

results.headline: It’s Not Quite Hollywood Above the 38th Parallel

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Juche Idea

results.summary_short: “The Juche Idea” is a mockumentary set in North Korea but about capitalism too.

results.headline: An Action Hero as an Unbearable Being of Lightness

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of MacGruber

results.summary_short: Will Forte stars as the title character in “MacGruber,” an action comedy film based on the “Saturday Night Live” sketch.

results.headline: Yes, He’s a Jerk, but There’s Something About Ben

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Solitary Man

results.summary_short: In “Solitary Man,” Michael Douglas plays a liar, cynic, compulsive womanizer and all-around jerk.

results.headline: I’m Green and the Kids Are a Pain, but It’s a Wonderful Life, Donkey

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Shrek Forever After

results.summary_short: In “Shrek Forever After,” the ogre confronts a midlife crisis with a Faustian agreement.

results.headline: Bad and Badder Guys, One With a Debt to Pay

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Perrier's Bounty

results.summary_short: A gangster caper set in Dublin, “Perrier’s Bounty” stars Jim Broadbent and Cillian Murphy.

results.headline: Bollywood Does Vegas

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Kites

results.summary_short: To seduce audiences resistant to the over-the-top Indian-made romance, “Kites,” set in Nevada, substitutes explosions for dances.

results.headline: A Nazi Businessman Risks His Life to Do the Right Thing? It’s True

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of John Rabe

results.summary_short: “John Rabe” is about the unsung hero of an infamous Rape of Nanking.

results.headline: A Drug Dealer Who’s Hasidic

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Holy Rollers

results.summary_short: Jesse Eisenberg stars in “Holy Rollers,” a tale of a Hasid drawn into a life of crime.

results.headline: That Post-Championship Season
results.display_title: After the Cup: Sons of Sakhnin United

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of After the Cup: Sons of Sakhnin United

results.summary_short: “After the Cup” is a documentary account of an Israeli soccer team made up of Arabs and Jews that became a reluctant symbol of national unity.

results.headline: Two Daring Directors Who Changed Film History

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Two in the Wave

results.summary_short: “Two in the Wave,” about the French New Wave filmmakers François Truffaut and Jean-Luc Godard, is interested in its subjects’ artistic personalities.

results.headline: A Sci-Fi Love Story

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of TiMER

results.summary_short: “Timer” explores the choices that come when you know when you’ll meet your soul mate.

results.headline: Life, Death and Other Subjects

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Living Wake

results.summary_short: “The Living Wake” captures the final day in the life of a self-aggrandizing antihero.

results.headline: In 1953 Iran, Sisterhood Sought During a Coup

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Women Without Men

results.summary_short: In “Women Without Men,” the lives of four Iranian women cross as the Shah is installed as dictator.

results.headline: For Dad, There Are 2 Outs in the Bottom of the 9th

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Touching Home

results.summary_short: Ed Harris stars as an alcoholic father in an independent film, “Touching Home.”

results.headline: Rob the Rich? Give to the Poor? Oh, Puh-leeze!

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Robin Hood

results.summary_short: Russell Crowe and Cate Blanchett star in “Robin Hood,” Ridley Scott’s take on the title character’s early life.

results.headline: A Nod to History in Tale of a Hawaiian Aristocrat and Romance

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Princess Kaiulani

results.summary_short: Q’orianka Kilcher, who played Pocahantas in “The New World,” now stars in “Princess Kaiulani,” a period film about the Hawaiian monarchy.
